column1: Rarely, other methods are used for collecting CSF such as: - Cisternal puncture - Ventricular puncture - Removal of CSF from a tube that is already in the CSF, such as a shunt or ventricular drain.
You may have this test to help diagnose: - Tumors - Infection - Inflammation of several groups of nerve cells - Vasculitis - Blood in the spinal fluid - Multiple sclerosis (MS)
An abnormal protein level in the CSF suggests a problem in the central nervous system.
